metadata.title: CVE-2020-12655 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in xfs_agf_verify in fs/xfs/libxfs/xfs_alloc.c inthe Linux kernel through 5.6.10. Attackers may trigger a sync of excessiveduration via an XFS v5 image with crafted metadata, aka CID-d0c7feaf8767.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1080-aws - 4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1081-gcp - 4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-oracle - 4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
